item.title: Arc Raiders Cold Snap Update: Start Date, New Map Condition, And Everything We Know So Far
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Arc Raiders has been the talk of the town in the multiplayer arena over the past two months, landing a nomination for Best Multiplayer Game at The Game Awards and becoming one of the most played games in recent weeks. As players prep for this month's upcoming Expedition--an optional wipe that resets much of their progress in exchange for in-game rewards--they'll also be treated to the fresh Cold Snap update. This new content includes an additional snow-based map condition, a premium Raider Deck, and another event to complete for goodies. Here's everything we know about it so far.

Cold Snap release date

Arc Raiders' Cold Snap update will release on December 16, 2025. While we don't know an exact launch time for this update yet, the previous North Line update launched at 1:30 AM PT / 4:30 AM ET, so it's safe to assume this one may also launch in the wee hours of the morning for US-based players.

The Cold Snap update falls just one day before the Expedition window opens, which will allow players to send their raider off and reset much of their in-game progress any time before December 22. This should give dedicated players at least a few days to see this fresh content on their current raider before sending them off and starting anew.

Snowfall map condition

The Cold Snap update will feature the new snowfall map condition. While we don't know everything this condition will entail, we do know that heavy snow will reduce visibility and muffle sound, which should force players to engage in close-quarters combat--or tuck tail and run in another direction. Choosing the latter, though, may open you up to ambushes, as players will leave footprints in the snow that allow other raiders to track you more easily.

As with other map conditions, snowfall will rotate across a few of the game's existing maps and almost certainly increase loot value as an incentive for visiting and exploring the hazards within. Embark hasn't specified which maps will receive this condition yet, but based on layouts and existing map condition rotations, our best guess is Buried City and Blue Gate.

Arc Raiders Review

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

More quests

As with the North Line update, the traders back in Speranza will have a few new quests for you to complete when Cold Snap releases. We don't know how many quests there will be yet, but we anticipate they'll require you to visit the Snowfall map condition to complete at least some of the requirements.

Once we've checked out the new quests, we'll be sure to add them to our full Arc Raiders quest list, where you can find guides on how to complete them.

Flickering Flames event

The Cold Snap update also includes an all-new event. Similar to North Line's Breaking New Ground update, players will be tasked with contributing resources or completing tasks during raids to work toward a series of rewards. These events function much like a mini-battle pass, requiring a meaningful time investment without asking too much of players who just want to dive in casually.

New Raider Deck

In addition to the Flickering Flames event, players will also have a new Raider Deck (seasonal battle pass) to complete for cosmetics and more. This one is expected to be a premium deck, meaning you'll likely need to purchase it with real money before you can access all its content. However, we assume that the game's existing Creds currency will be used to buy each item in-game after you've unlocked the premium access, but we'll certainly update you when we know for sure.

For more on this extraction shooter, check out our Arc Raiders guide hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: WoW Player Houses Are Now Officially Allowed To Fly
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

World of Warcraft players are pushing the game's new player-housing system to its limit, including defying the laws of gravity in a way Blizzard never intended. But rather than fix the ability to send houses skyward, Blizzard is instead embracing it.

When housing first arrived on December 2 as part of patch 11.2.7, it didn't take long for players to discover that, while the UI didn't show it, houses could actually be lifted off the ground using keybinds. The result was players making all kinds of airborne housing creations, including elaborate treehouses, airships, mechs, homes held up by kites, and everything in between.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: World of Warcraft - Housing 101 Overview Trailer

In a forum post, WoW community manager Randy Jordan (aka Kaivax) stated that instead of fixing the ability to elevate houses, Blizzard has with this week's scheduled maintenance actually made it easier by enabling proper controls to move houses upward.

That said, Blizzard does have some concerns. Since it never intended houses to be seen from underneath, the bottom of houses don't have proper textures, so players may want to hide or obscure that part of their home. Having a house in the sky also makes it difficult to reach the front door, so Blizzard advised building a ramp, a mount landing pad, or a jumping puzzle to make the front door accessible.

Being able to craft flying houses without fear of Blizzard bringing them back to the ground isn't the only good housing news. Blizzard also announced it increased the exterior-housing decor limit from 200 to 250 at housing level three.

"One of the biggest pieces of feedback we've gotten over the past few weeks was that the exterior decor budget felt too restrictive," Jordan said. "This was intentionally set to 200 to address performance concerns. Now that we have some data from live servers to look at, we're happy to conclude that we can increase this limit by 25%."

The increased exterior decor limit should result in even more fantastical creations--something that is hardly in short supply. Housing in Blizzard's MMORPG has brought plenty of suprises, including news that the game may soon allow for wedding ceremonies.

WoW player housing is currently in early access, with the full version of the feature set to arrive with the release of the game's Midnight expansion in March 2026. Buying a home in WoW and earning the "Weclome Home" achievement also grants players a number of cosmetics in other Blizzard games, including a Xal'atath-themed Overwatch 2 skin.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Sony Might Have Leaked Leon Kennedy In Resident Evil Requiem
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

While we're still a couple of months away from Resident Evil Requiem's release, it looks like there could be a surprise return awaiting fans. Before it was removed, the PlayStation Store revealed new cover art for the game that featured longtime Resident Evil protagonist Leon Kennedy. PlayStation 5 players noticed the art on the pre-download screen for owners of the standard (non-Deluxe) version of the game.

IGN later confirmed the art, which showed a stubbled and haggard-looking Leon hovering over Requiem's other main protagonist, Grace Ashcroft. Leon appeared similar to his Resident Evil 4 look, with his fur-lined leather jacket, albeit a bit more grizzled.

High-res image of the official Leon S. Kennedy version of the Resident Evil Requiem Playstation 5 icon that Sony accidentally leaked. pic.twitter.com/UpmAjU1LCp

â€” AestheticGamer aka Dusk Golem (@AestheticGamer1) December 9, 2025

Leon's inclusion in the game has been something that Capcom has vehemently denied, with even producer Masato Kumazawa denouncing alleged leaked images of Leon going around last month. "There has been a photo lately of Leon with an eyepatch, and just basically saying there's a DLC or a new costume for Leon--but just to make sure, these are all fake news," he told Stevivor in an interview, and added not to believe anything at face value.

So even though there was an attempt to keep Leon's involvement under wraps, Requiem still has plenty of surprises. Earlier this week, a GameStop listing mentioned another character who hasn't been officially revealed yet: Rosemary Winters, who fans think will have a smaller role. It also looks like if she shows up, she'll still have both of her eyes.

Resident Evil Requiem launches on February 27, 2026, for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, Switch 2, and PC.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Star Wars: Unlimited TCG Booster Boxes Are Super Cheap At Amazon Right Now
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Star Wars: Unlimited Trading Card Game Booster Boxes and Starter Sets are on sale for extremely low prices at Amazon. Three Booster Boxes are available for over 50% off, including Legends of the Force, Jump to Lightspeed, and Twilight of the Republic. If you're interested in playing Asmodee's Star Wars TCG for the first time, the Starter Sets come with two ready-to-play decks and all of the accessories you need to dive in. Twilight of the Republic's Starter Set is discounted to only $18.80 (was $35), and Shadows of the Galaxy's Starter Set is $21.17 (was $35).

Along with the deals, Star Wars: Unlimited collectors can pick up the 2025 Gift Box for $30 at Amazon. The Gift Box comes with three exclusive cards and eight Booster Packs, which makes it a nice option for existing players and collectors as well as newcomers.

Star Wars: Unlimited - Booster Box Deals

Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Boxes include 24 packs with 16 cards each (384 cards total). The Legend of the Force Booster Box is the cheapest at $52.20 (was $120). With Amazon's deal price, you're only paying $2.17 per Booster Pack. Twilight of the Republic and Jump to Lightspeed are also discounted below $60. Amazon also has a deal on the Booster Box for Secrets of Power, the new Star Wars: Unlimited set that launched in November.

  • Legends of the Force (24 Packs) -- $52.20 ($120)
  • Twilight of the Republic (24 Packs) -- $54 ($120)
  • Jump to Lightspeed (24 Packs) -- $58.12 ($120)
  • Secrets of Power (24 Packs) -- $88 ($120)
  • Shadows of the Galaxy (24 Packs) -- $85.67 ($120)
  • Spark of Rebellion (24 Packs) -- $84.45 ($120)

Star Wars: Unlimited - Starter Sets & Spotlight Decks

The Starter Sets come with two 50-card decks, themed deck boxes, damage counters, and a quickstart guide. Each set includes one deck themed around the Rebellion and one for the Galactic Empire. The Twilight of the Republic Starter Set is led by Ahsoka and General Grievous, while Shadows of the Galaxy features The Mandalorian and Moff Gideon.

Asmodee stopped making Starter Sets after Twilight of the Republic. The last three sets have included two $25 Spotlight Decks instead. You can save on Legends of the Force and Jump to Lightspeed Spotlight Decks at Amazon. The Boba Fett Spotlight Deck is the cheapest at $18.87. In addition to the 50-card deck, each Spotlight Deck comes with a booster pack.

  • Twilight of the Republic Starter Set (2 Decks) -- $18.80 ($35)
  • Shadows of the Galaxy Starter Set (2 Decks) -- $21.17 ($35)
  • Legends of the Force Spotlight Decks
    • Darth Maul -- $21.74 ($25)
    • Qui-Gon Jinn -- $20.63 ($25)
  • Jump to Lightspeed Spotlight Decks
    • Han Solo -- $21 ($25)
    • Boba Fett -- $18.87 ($25)
  • Secrets of Power Spotlight Decks
    • Chancellor Palpatine -- $25
    • Padme Amidala -- $25

Star Wars: Unlimited TCG - 2025 Gift Box

$30

The first Star Wars: Unlimited Gift Box is basically a sampler platter, as it includes cards from four different sets. You'll get eight Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Packs, two exclusive variant cards, and one oversized leader card.

  • 2 Twilight of the Republic Booster Packs
  • 2 Jump to Lightspeed Booster Packs
  • 2 Legends of the Force Booster Packs
  • 2 Secrets of Power Booster Packs
  • Exclusive Obi-wan Kenobi Card
  • Exclusive Darth Sidious Card
  • Oversized Qui-Go Jinn Card

Browse Star Wars: Unlimited TCG by category:

For more Star Wars: Unlimited deals, check out the Amazon store pages we created based on category. Amazon has deals on several prerelease boxes right now. New players should also check out the recently released Intro Battle Hoth game for $20. Similar to Pokemon Battle Academy, Intro Battle Hoth is essentially a board game version of Star Wars: Unlimited.

item.title: PlayStation 2025 Wrap-Up: See How Much You Played This Year
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Yearly wraps have become an annual tradition across various platforms, and PlayStation is no exception. The PlayStation Wrap website has gone live, and once again, members of the PlayStation community can explore the total number of hours spent across single-player and multiplayer games. You'll have until January 8 to check out your stats--PlayStation Wrap-Up will continue to update until then--and users can redeem a unique glass-themed avatar once they complete their tour down memory lane.

This year's PlayStation Wrap-Up also includes a look at the number of games played on PS5 and PS4, a closer look at your gaming style, and even the DualSense controller you used the most. If you've used other PlayStation accessories, such as PlayStation VR2 or the PlayStation Portal handheld, those stats will also be included in your personal wrap-up. Additionally, you can get a brief look at how active you were on PlayStation Plus throughout the year, and Sony is also offering a curated list of recommended games to try out through the subscription service, if you're a member of the Premium or Extra tiers.

Ghost of Yotei, Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, Blue Prince, and Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 were considerable timesinks, while other noteworthy releases included games like Ball x Pit, Elden Ring Nightreign, and Battlefield 6 kept players glued to their screens for many hours.

What will the 2026 edition of PlayStation Wrap-Up look like? While things can still change, some of the big upcoming releases include Resident Evil Requiem, 007: First Light, and Yakuza Kiwami 3. Of course, if it doesn't suffer another delay, we expect the November 2026 release of Grand Theft Auto 6 to rank high on next year's list of the top five most-played games.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/playstation-2025-wrap-up-see-how-much-you-played-this-year/1100-6536799/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
